title: Bonds lured £5.4bn from investment industry
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Bonds lured £5.4bn from investment industry NS&I took in £9.1 billion in gross new sales in the three months to June James Glossop/The Times Google+ 1 of 1 NS&I took in £9.1 billion in gross new sales in the three months to June James Glossop/The Times Patrick Hosking Financial Editor Published 1 minute ago 
National Savings & Investments has been accused of unfairly poaching customers from the private savings industry after it revealed that it had sucked in a mammoth £5.4 billion from savers in the three months to June, sending its total balances to an all-time high. 
Depositors rushed to buy NS&I pensioner bonds during the period, while wealthy savers took advantage of the lifting of the ceiling on individual holdings of premium bonds from £40,000 to £50,000.
